volop.name: Food Rescuer - Morristown, Morris County, NJ
volop.description: Our volunteers recover healthy meals from commercial donor cafeterias and deliver them to specified nearby non-profit organizations. Every meal saved stays out of the landfill, helping the environment, while also nourishing our community in need. The volunteer role would involve:- Picking up meals from our donor cafeteria, and- Delivering these meals to our non-profit community partner/s in the nearby area. Each volunteer task will take approximately one hour including travel time between donor and recipient. Pick-up and deliveries times will be on a week day (not at weekends) and can be anywhere from early morning to mid afternoon, depending on the donor. We require volunteers to drive their own car. We welcome regular participation but will work with your schedule. Insulated bags will be provided to carry food donations.We are looking for volunteers to rescue and transport food on Wednesdays and Friday afternoons at approximately 2:30 from one location in Morristown to another in Morristown. We are also looking for a volunteer to transport food on Tuesdays at 1:30 p.m. from one locations in Morristown to another in Morristown.

address.full: 120 John Street, PRINCETON, New Jersey, US

volop.commitmentDetails: Volunteer jobs usually take about 60 minutes but can be less depending on the assignment. We welcome regular participation but will work with your schedule.
volop.otherRequirements: Volunteers will need access to a car, a valid driver's license and adequate auto insurance. They will also need a smartphone and be comfortable lifting and carrying large bags containing several meal trays.
